attributes.action: stop potentially lethal electrical products being imported into the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
An investigation into replacement chargers uncovered major safety concerns, such as overheating, fires and a risk of electric shock. The investigation exposed the difficulties stopping unsafe chargers from being imported into the UK.

At roughly 2 million units a year in online sales in the UK, a serious accident is inevitable.

To guarantee the safety of imported products, we call for: 

· A statutory independent testing regime to test imported goods, prior to them being supplied to the public. 

· The creation, by government, of an independent single agency to protect the public’s health and consumer interests.

· A registration scheme for businesses manufacturing, importing or supplying electrical goods to enable local authorities and regulatory bodies to locate and advise/monitor them if needed.


· On-the-spot fines for obvious failures of product safety regulations which would help ensure suppliers fulfil their obligation to supply safe goods.

· Reintroduction of a government funded central database listing details of incidents and injuries in the home and outside to highlight trends and areas of concern more quickly and effectively.
